reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We travelled down to the summer solstice from the Midlands. The room was comfortable and clean.
reviews.title: Lovley relxed hotel, friendly and helpfull staff

reviews.text: Great location for Stonehenge, of course, but also Salisbury, Bath and Longleat house.
reviews.title: Perfect place to stay in Amesbury
Excellent Hotel
reviews.text: Definatley stay again!

We spent a night here en route from London to Devon. Great place with lots of charm. Very friendly owners who were knowledgeable about the area and best times to visit Stonehenge & Salisbury. Breakfast was a wonderful traditional full English breakfast, served downstairs in their dining room, which was tastefully decorated in a modern style. We will definitely stay again if we're in the area!
reviews.title: A First class hotel for the everyday businessman to use and enjoy.

reviews.text: Lovely hotel to stay at. Hosts were very freindly and very helpful. Would happily visit again.
reviews.title: Wonderfull Hotel with outstanding hosts!

reviews.text: Booked for one night to recover from jetlag before trip down to Devon.
reviews.title: Great B&B offering much nicer alternative than nearby hotel chains

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Owners, as mentioned in all posts, were very kind and pleasant!
reviews.title: A hotel that deserves to do well

reviews.text: Easy access from Amesbury high street. Parking is around the back on a side road shared by a health centre.
reviews.title: Cosy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was fine. Nice flatscreen TV. Sofa sleeper worked for 6 year old. Beds, not bad. Downstairs living room, very comfortable with TV and books and maps available.
reviews.title: Delightful accomodations and staff
If you are visiting Stonehenge or the area nearby it is the only place to stay
reviews.text: Included English breakfast was excellent (although wish they could extend service by an hour at the weekend.) Great lower level breakfast room.

A great B&B. Good rooms, quiet and breakfast, on the day I was able to get up late enough to catch it, was superb. When I had to get up at the crack of dawn I was supplied the night before with a "breakfast in a bag" which was a real lifesaver.
reviews.title: Certainly deserves it's top rating

reviews.text: I have stayed here for work since early March and it is a wonderful place. Tracey and Keith are fantastic hosts as well as their children, especially Daisy who always made me smile. Breakfasts are excellent and if you want anything then the hosts will always help out. A big thank you to Tracey, Keith, Christina and Freda (and Daisy of course) for making my stay in the area a wonderful experience - especially when so far from home.
reviews.title: Absolutely fabulous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel because we had a dawn reservation for the Inside the Stones tour of Stonehenge. As we had to be there before dawn, we wanted to be very close. This hotel did not disappoint. It's also very convenient to Salisbury.
reviews.title: Close to Stonehenge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tracey welcomed us and made us feel right at home. We were up and out very early and home in time for a delicious breakfast. The parking is very convenient too.
reviews.title: Lovely stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was on the second floor and very clean and comfortable. We would stay here again in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Beautiful Georgian house - lovely welcome, excellent breakfasts!

reviews.text: I've been staying here at Fairlawn House since January this year as I work on local building sites.
reviews.title: fantastic!

reviews.text: Tracey and Keith have been very helpful, welcoming and warm from day 1.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: The rooms are always fresh and clean, all members of staff are friendly and breakfast is ALWAYS perfect! (Thanks for the omelettes Keith!)
reviews.title: Warm, welcoming and cosy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Of all the hotels I've stayed in over the last few years with work, this one outshines them all in every aspect. Always welcomed with a genuine smile and looked after like old friends.
reviews.title: Half way find

reviews.text: I really can't recommend Fairlawn House high enough as there aren't enough stars!
reviews.title: A night near Stonehenge

reviews.text: Stoped in amesbury on the way to london, and found this little gem, lovely building cosy bar and the owners Colin and Lynda were very helpfull. My laptop had died on me and was able to use a hotel one in front of the fire with a very nice brandy in the bar. Best breakfast ive had in a long time aswell.
reviews.title: Spotlessly clean ,Great owners make you feel like a v.i.p

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Top Job thank you Fairlawn.
reviews.title: Great!

likes.liked: — It was cozy, atmospheric, and the breakfast was delicious

reviews.title: Great place and lovely hosts "Colin & Linda"
reviews.text: I could not recommend this hotel more! The couple who own and run it are sweet, friendly, and very helpful. The rooms are beautiful and very comfortable, clean, and the entire hotel was very atmospheric.
Breakfast was included and personally cooked by the owner Lynda, and consisted of an absolutely fantastic full English breakfast with sausages, bacon, the full shebang.
reviews.title: a very nice B&B near Stonehenge

reviews.text: All in all, my girlfriend and I loved our stay at this gem of a hotel, and would definitely recommend it to anybody who is looking for a place to stay around Wiltshire!
reviews.title: Friendly but unobstrusve service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: if your looking for accomodation close to stonehenge and the Indian restaurant Tandoori nights in Amesbury then look no further...this is it...
reviews.title: GREAT ACCOMODATION

reviews.text: I cant fault anything with fairlawn House. Just A great convenient place to stay and quiet.
reviews.title: First Class

reviews.text: I am a very critical person, and even I could not find fault with this establishment.
reviews.title: Best B&B in Amesbury

reviews.text: First impressions of the bedroom (triple) was that it was basic and a bit tired. On further investigation the room was clean and had everything we required. The property is being refurbished and the lounge, reception area and breakfast room have all been done to a very high standard.
reviews.title: travel to amesbury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The owners made you feel very welcome and it is the first time that we have sat in the lounge area of any bed and breakfast. The breakfasts were cooked to order and delicious.
reviews.title: Wouldn't stay anywhere else in the area!

reviews.text: We had tickets for early admission to Stonehenge. This is highly recommended - you pay a bit more than normal admission, but have access to the stones themselves with only 24 people for an hour. You have to be there very early, however, and as the Fairlawn is only a few minutes' drive away, it is perfectly located.
reviews.title: Perfect place for a visit to Stonehenge and Salisbury

reviews.text: The owners were very pleasant and helpful (including excellent advise on parking in Salisbury).
reviews.title: Really great B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were clean, reasonably spacious and very comfortable.
reviews.title: VERY HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

reviews.text: Breakfast was made-to-order and delicious after our early-morning visit to Stonehenge!
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel, Service to Die For

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved this B&B. We got a nice big and spacious room, which was clean and had everything we needed. The beds were excellent. There were also a shower, which would be the only thing we would rate as negative. The amount of water that came out of the shower was to poor.
reviews.title: Generally Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here as we were at a party at a party in Amnesbury. Spotlessly clean, bathroom is a little tired and shower not great but nevertheless immaculate. Friendly owners, we could park outside, free wi-fi , great breakfast. Good value £80 for Saturday night.
reviews.title: Lovely did the job

reviews.text: We stayed here as a group over the weekend. It was stunning. Very peaceful, very very clean and tidy. Very homely and very cosy and English! the family are wonderful people. the Breakfast was just amazing (try the eggs!) and the bar on the evening was just really lovely. Thank you for a lovely time we are coming again next year. I highly recommend this little place to stay especially if you are visiting Stonehenge as we were. Its right in the heart of Amesbury and on easy access routes. A truly lovely Place. Keep it up guys! you are doing it so right! with love, Tammy xxx
reviews.title: A superb Little Place!

reviews.text: I stayed at the Farlawn House Hotel in Amesbury for 8 months (January 2012 to September 2012). Throughout this time the hotel service was truly excellent providing me with rooms ( I think I stayed in most of them over the time was there) that were spotlessly clean, very comfortably warm in the cold weather and equally cool in the Spring/Summer. The TV reception (cable link?) was a little 'flakey' but the wall mounted set up in most rooms was well received when I wanted to put my feet up after work and catch the news etc. No 'SKY' facility and for the room rate that was understandable, however, a full suite, including live televised sport was available across the road in the very hospitable George Hotel. The 'full English' breakfast was lovely and deviations were available on request and without fuss. An evening meal wasn't available although this was trialled for a short period of time during my stay and on the few occasions I ate, the meal was good but with the numerous outlets nearby collectively offering a wider variety of food, I preferred to use them as it seemed, did most of the other guests and the service was terminated. Car parking was surprisingly easy and on most occasions I was able to leave my vehicle after 1800 in the high street outside the hotel and if that was not possible the public car park at the rear of the building was avaialble with a 'hotel car pass' dispayed. The family management team was really warm and friendly and made me feel at home; nothing seemed too much trouble while always helpful, notably, in the early days as I had never been to that part of the country before and needed some asssistance in navigating my way around. I highly recommend this hotel; top value for money for both social and business uses, particularly, the latter when compared to the return from the Holiday Inn at Solstice Park and other well known operators in the area.
reviews.title: LONG STAY AT THE FAIRLWN HOUSE HOTEL IN AMESBURY

reviews.text: Warm welcome and excellent service. Breakfast was tasty and plentiful, awesome bacon! Lovely family run business with added extra of a bar to have a nice cold beverage, good location. We would definitely stay again and wouldn't hesitate to recommend.
reviews.title: Lovely place to stay!

reviews.text: I had a lovely stay here recently. The rooms were laid out well, comfortable bed and amenities. Spotlessly clean. At breakfast, probably the best poached eggs on toast I have ever eaten. The dining room is beautiful and spacious.
reviews.title: Superb
